channel.title: Pascal,
channel.description:
Hannah says: yeah I know and i'm really stuck on the coursework Ashley says: how come? Ashley says: tell me what your stuck with and i can always ask someone. Hannah says: right well we have to write a program fora petrol pump so you need it to say the price of the petrol the amount you have pumped and the cost all very well but it needs to be done in 7 segment display (Like a calculator) which means each letter has to be stored in an array of like 5 by 3
So yea anyone help out please. Im not a pascal programmer at all otherwise i'd help. Cheers.

item.title: Pascal,
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

It is not a problem of types.

        case AmountSSD[K] of
            '1':Number1;
            '2':Number2;
            '3':Number3;
            '4':Number4;
            '5':Number5;
            '6':Number6;
            '7':Number7;
            '8':Number8;
            '9':Number9;
            '0':Number0;
            '.':NumberDot;
        end;

That case is wrong. AmountSSD[K] is NOT a string. It is an ARRAY of strings. Why, I don’t know. But you have declared AmountSSD as a bidimensional array of strings, so AmountSSD[K] is a monodimensional array of strings.

I suppose what you wanna do is simply this:

for i := 1 to length(str) do begin
  case str[i] of
   '1': Number1;
   '2': Number2;
   // ...
  end;
end;

Str being the ammount you want to print, stored in a string…

And BTW that FloatToStr you are using is doing nothing at the moment, because you are not storing the result anywhere.

If you still have problems, please write what you want to do in pseudo-code, that way it will be easier to understand.

Read full topic

item.title: Pascal,
item.dc:creator: @Superhan Superhan
item.description:
@Superhan wrote:

ok we haven’t learnt that yet… basically at the moment the program works on the basis that you press – until the customer has enough petrol this the amount is then worked out using length(SqueezeTrigger) this number is then displayed. I need this number to be displayed as 7 segment display. I have each number stored in an array the first line of each array needs to go first so the 2 numbers can be side by side in 7 segment. I used another program I had already made to do this and copied and pasted bits etc but there is a problem with the case apprently it needs to be a different type but I don’t know how to change this as if I change the type of variable to string it obviously wont let me do arimatic i need to do to work out the cost of the petrol… basically…

Read full topic

item.title: Pascal,
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

Superhan:

i’m not sure what an ordinal is…

In Delphi, a type is an ordinal type if its values have a Predecessor (through the Pred function), and a Successor (through the Succ function). Integers, Sets, Chars, etc, are ordinals, whereas Reals, Strings, etc are not.

Note that being ordinal is not directly related to being ordered. A real number, for example, is not an ordinal, because the distance between a real value and its successor would be infinitesimal.

Read full topic

item.title: Pascal,
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

I don’t understand what are you trying to do. First, make sure that you know what you want to do, then, if you still don’t know how to do it in Pascal, write it in pseudo-code and we can help you translate.

Also, I don’t know how FloatToStr would help with the case issue. You are using a case on an array of strings. It doesn’t make any sense, not only because of the limitations of a case (that is, because an array of strings is in no way ordinal) but because comparing an ARRAY of strings to a single character or a single string, makes no sense at all.

Also note that neither Floats, nor Strings, are ordinals.

Read full topic

item.title: Pascal,
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

There seem to be errors in the code, it doesn’t compile.

Maybe there are more problems, but, among other things, the case is wrong. You are for some reason doing the case on AmountSSD[K], which is simply an array of strings. You can only do a case on an ordinal type.

Also, it is usually considered bad style to access globals from subprograms, as it leads to hard to understand code.

Read full topic

item.title: Pascal,
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

What’s exactly the problem? And why do you need to store each digit in a 5 by 3 array? A 7-segment display has 7 segment, wouldn’t an array of 7 booleans be enough to fully describe the state of a 7 segment?

Read full topic
